com.github.javactic

Class Accumulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.javactic.Accumulation

  • public final class Accumulation
extends Object
    Provides mechanisms that enable errors to be accumulated in "accumulating Ors," Ors whose Bad type is an Every.

    The mechanisms are:

    • Passing accumulating Ors to withGood methods
    • Invoking combined on a container of accumulating Ors
    • Invoking validatedBy on a container of any type, passing in a function from that type to an accumulating Or
    • Invoking zip on an accumulating Or
    • Invoking when on an accumulating Or
    Author:
    mvh

    • Method Detail

      • combined

        public static <G,ERR> Or<Vector<G>,Every<ERR>> combined(Iterable<? extends Or<? extends G,? extends Every<? extends ERR>>> input)
        Combines an Iterable of Ors of type Or<G, EVERY<ERR>> (where EVERY is some subtype of Every) into a single Or of type Or<Vector<G>, Every<ERR>>.
        Type Parameters:
        G - the success type of the resulting Or
        ERR - the failure type of the resulting Or
        Parameters:
        input - the iterable containing Ors to combine
        Returns:
        an Or of all the success values or of all the errors

      • combined

        public static <G,A,ERR,I extends Iterable<? extends G>> Or<I,Every<ERR>> combined(Iterable<? extends Or<? extends G,? extends Every<? extends ERR>>> input,
                                                                                  Collector<? super G,A,I> collector)
        Combines an Iterable of Ors of type Or<G, EVERY<ERR>> (where EVERY is some subtype of Every) into a single Or of type Or<COLL<G>, Every<ERR>> using a Collector to determine the wanted collection type COLL.
        Type Parameters:
        G - the success type of the resulting Or
        A - the mutable accumulation type of the reduction operation of the collector
        ERR - the failure type of the resulting Or
        I - the resulting success iterable type
        Parameters:
        input - the iterable containing Ors to combine
        collector - the collector producing the resulting collection
        Returns:
        an Or of all the success values or of all the errors

      • validatedBy

        public static <F,G,ERR> Or<Vector<G>,Every<ERR>> validatedBy(Iterable<? extends F> iterable,
                                                             Function<? super F,? extends Or<? extends G,? extends Every<? extends ERR>>> f)
        Maps an iterable of Fs into an Ors of type Or<G, EVERY<ERR>> (where EVERY is some subtype of Every) using the passed function f, then combines the resulting Ors into a single Or of type Or<Vector<G>, Every<ERR>>.

        Note: the process implemented by this method is sometimes called a "traverse".

        Type Parameters:
        F - the type of the original iterable to validate
        G - the Good type of the resulting Or
        ERR - the Bad type of the resulting Or
        Parameters:
        iterable - the iterable to validate
        f - the validation function
        Returns:
        an Or of all the success values or of all the errors

      • validatedBy

        public static <F,G,A,I extends Iterable<? extends G>,ERR> Or<I,Every<ERR>> validatedBy(Iterable<? extends F> iterable,
                                                                                       Function<? super F,? extends Or<? extends G,? extends Every<? extends ERR>>> f,
                                                                                       Collector<? super G,A,I> collector)
        Maps an iterable of Fs into Ors of type Or<G, EVERY<ERR>> (where EVERY is some subtype of Every) using the passed function f, then combines the resulting Ors into a single Or of type Or<COLL<G>, Every<ERR>> using a Collector to determine the wanted collection type COLL.

        Note: the process implemented by this method is sometimes called a "traverse".

        Type Parameters:
        F - the type of the original iterable to validate
        G - the Good type of the resulting Or
        A - the mutable accumulation type of the reduction operation of the collector
        I - the result type of the reduction operation
        ERR - the Bad type of the resulting Or
        Parameters:
        iterable - the iterable to validate
        f - the validation function
        collector - the collector producing the resulting collection
        Returns:
        an Or of all the success values or of all the errors

      • when

        @SafeVarargs
public static <G,ERR> Or<G,Every<ERR>> when(Or<? extends G,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> or,
                                                         Function<? super G,? extends Validation<ERR>>... validations)
        Enables further validation on an existing accumulating Or by passing validation functions.
        Type Parameters:
        G - the Good type of the argument Or
        ERR - the type of the error message contained in the accumulating failure
        Parameters:
        or - the accumulating or
        validations - the validation functions
        Returns:
        the original or if it passed all validations or a Bad with all failures

      • zip

        public static <A,B,ERR> Or<Tuple2<A,B>,Every<ERR>> zip(Or<? extends A,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> a,
                                                       Or<? extends B,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> b)
        Zips two accumulating Ors together. If both are Good, returns a Good tuple containing both original Good values. Otherwise, returns a Bad containing every error message.
        Type Parameters:
        A - the success type of the first Or
        B - the success type of the second Or
        ERR - the error type of the accumulating Ors
        Parameters:
        a - the first Or to zip
        b - the second Or to zip
        Returns:
        an Or with a success type of Tuple2

      • zip3

        public static <A,B,C,ERR> Or<Tuple3<A,B,C>,Every<ERR>> zip3(Or<? extends A,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> a,
                                                            Or<? extends B,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> b,
                                                            Or<? extends C,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> c)

      • withGood

        public static <A,B,ERR,RESULT> Or<RESULT,Every<ERR>> withGood(Or<? extends A,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> a,
                                                              Or<? extends B,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> b,
                                                              BiFunction<? super A,? super B,? extends RESULT> function)
        Combines two accumulating Or into a single one using the given function. The resulting Or will be a Good if both Ors are Goods, otherwise it will be a Bad containing every error in the Bads.
        Type Parameters:
        A - the success type of the first Or
        B - the success type of the second Or
        ERR - the error type of the Ors
        RESULT - the success type of the resulting Or
        Parameters:
        a - the first Or to combine
        b - the second Or to combine
        function - the function combining the Ors
        Returns:
        a Good if both Ors were Goods, otherwise a Bad with every error.
